title: Metals Prices Surge After Gas Crunch Crimps Output
sub_head: Higher energy bills prompt smelters to cut back on zinc and aluminum production
body:
Metals prices surged to multiyear highs after smelters, facing soaring energy bills and pressure to cut their carbon emissions, curtailed production.
Zinc prices on the London Metal Exchange jumped 3% Thursday to $3,533 a metric ton, their highest level in more than three years after Nyrstar , a major producer, said it was reducing output by half at three European plants.
